column2: Spur Lake WBIC 15771800. The majority of the lakes surface is covered in floating bogs and dense vegetation- which made it incredibly hard to navigate the canoe around the lake. In fact- we were only able to monitor about half of the shoreline.  Reported by Stephanie Boismenue
Lots of lily pads(yellow flowers) Lots of lily pad roots floating on surface. Lily pad root systems seem to go all the way to the bottom with silt.

column1: Sunny a 74 calm winds during collection . White swan on lake.

column2: Lots of lily pads mostly white flowered. The white swan was back again

column1: Lily pad roots coming to the surface. Some of them measure 6 inches in diameter

column2: Overcast and 57 degrees. Lots of lily pads.
Pair of swans on the lake this morning and lots of birds. Few ducks. 51 and sunny no wind
AEB: This data was erroneously placed on the area station; I moved it to the Deep Hole (443372) May 2021.

Lily pads are taking over the lake. Not a muskrat insight. So sad that they all have been trapped out- so nothing to stop or slow down the lily pad take over. This lake is turning into a bog really quick.
AEB: This data was erroneously placed on the area station; I moved it to the Deep Hole (443372) May 2021.
Lots and Lots of Lily Pads
